biography.value: Terrifying storms manifest in the bodies of elder tempests. Beings carved from clouds, wind, rain, and lightning, elder tempests assume the shape of serpents that slither through the sky. They drown the land beneath them with rain and stab the earth with lances of lightning. Punishing winds scream around them as they fly, feeding the chaos they create.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The tempest makes two Thunderous Slam attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 4d6 + @mod type=thunder average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
All other creatures within 120 feet of the tempest must each make a [[/save dex 21 format=long]], taking [[/damage 6d8 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target’s saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also &Reference[stunned]{stunned} until the end of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The tempest can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The tempest regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Move. The tempest moves up to its speed.

&Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Strike (Costs 2 Actions). The tempest can cause a bolt of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} to strike a point on the ground anywhere under its storm. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a [[/save dex 20 format=long]], taking [[/damage 3d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Screaming Gale (Costs 3 Actions). The tempest releases a blast of &Reference[thunder]{thunder} and wind in a &Reference[line]{line} that is 300 feet long and 20 feet wide. Objects in that area take [[/damage 4d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage. Each creature there must succeed on a [[/save dex 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage and be flung up to 60 feet in a direction away from the &Reference[line]{line}. If a thrown target collides with an immovable object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes [[/damage 1d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage for every 10 feet it was thrown before impact. If the target would collide with another creature instead, that other creature must succeed on a [[/save dex 19 format=long]] or take the same damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Air Form. The tempest can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Flyby. The tempest doesn’t provoke opportunity attack;opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Living Storm. The tempest is always at the center of a storm 1d6 + 4 miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on hearing. In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The winds extinguish open flames and disperse fog.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Siege Monster. The tempest deals double damage to objects and structures.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
